EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Copper Cable Factory at ~Position(2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following connected production elements:
– Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
– New factory burner inserter placed at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) using direction RIGHT
– Secondary burner inserter (as indicated in neighbour data) at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5)
– Assembling machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5)

### Belt Depot at Position(3.5, 15.5)
Built as an isolated belt target and connector, it comprises:
– Wooden chest serving as the belt depot at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
– Dedicated transport belt segment placed adjacent at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5)
– Depot burner inserter positioned at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) (using direction UP with its pickup at (3.5,15.5) and drop at (3.5,13.5))

### Electricity Generator at Position(-0.5, 24.5)
Assembled to supply power (pending correct connectivity), it includes:
– Steam engine (generator) at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)
– Boiler at Position(x=-5.5, y=24.0)
– Offshore pump at Position(x=-7.5, y=25.5)

ERROR TIPS

• Transport Belt Connection Errors (Steps 210, 211, 213–217)
 – Error: “Transport belts cannot be connected directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine object as a target.”
 – Tip: Always use an inserter that feeds items into the steam engine rather than attempting a direct belt connection.

• Placement Distance Issue (Step 212)
 – Error: Unable to place a wooden chest at (3.5,15.5) because the player’s position (0,0) is too far (distance 15.89 exceeds max 10).
 – Tip: Move closer to the intended target position before placing the entity.

• Inventory Availability Error (Step 213)
 – Error: “Could not place new wooden chest … No wooden_chest in inventory.”
 – Tip: Verify and ensure the required entity is present in the inventory prior to placement.

• Undefined Variable (Step 212)
 – Error: NameError indicating that “target_chest” is not defined.
 – Tip: Check variable naming and confirm that all required variables are properly declared before use.
